answerText: prions[10] Prions are composed of these proteins that cannot be denatured by enzymes. The "common" variety of this is structurally well-defined, while the "scrapie" variety has extra beta-sheet content.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Lawrence U and Georgia Tech | 10 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: They lack nucleic acid and cause Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease and scrapie. For 10 points each.  [10] Name these infectious agents composed of misfolded proteins. They induce amyloid folds and are an exception to the central dogma of molecular biology.
